title: How can I create an `__m128i` datatype with Frida?
content:
I'm working on reversing a c++ binary and it has a function that I want to call with Frida. Here's the function signature from IDA: const __m128i *__fastcall sub_0123(__m128i * a1);

It doesn't seem possible to create an __m128i datatype in a Frida script. Does anyone know how to achieve this?

For reference, I am on android and this is an Intel x64 intrinsic. Info on the datatype here: http://portal.nacad.ufrj.br/online/intel/compiler_c/common/core/GUID-7478B278-2240-44D8-B396-1DC508E3656E.htm

comments.text: You should give more details on what the datataype __m128i is, is it a struct, a class or what else? What platform are you on (Windows, Linux, MacOS, Android, iOS)?
I am on android. As far as I can tell, it's an intel intrinsic. I found this link about them: portal.nacad.ufrj.br/online/intel/compiler_c/common/core/â€¦
